item.title: Glowing Ita Bag
item.description:
This project uses an Adafruit Circuit Playground to animate addressable LEDs arranged in a heart shape. The LEDs backlight acrylic charms pinned to a layer of fabric over the LEDs.

item.title: LED Protest Sign
item.description:
I made a re-usable LED protest sign. This sign is powered by an Adafruit M0 Adalogger. A text file with messages is stored on the LED card, and messages scroll across the LED matrix. The holder uses a dipswitch to select the message from the text file.

I brought this sign to the March for Science in Washington, DC, on April 22, 2017. Although it was raining, a clear plastic trashbag protected it from the elements, and it survived the march.

item.title: Glow Cloud Dress
item.description:
This is my cosplay of the Glow Cloud from the podcast Welcome to Night Vale. I wore this cosplay to the 2017 live show in Washington, DC. The live show focused on the Glow Cloud, so I knew I had to one-up my glow cloud from last year. My cosplay was featured on the official WTNV instagram here.

This project uses an Adafruit Circuit Playground to animate addressable LEDs on a hoop skirt.

item.title: Cheerlights Christmas Tree
item.description:
The Cheerlights API lets anyone tweet @cheerlights to change the color of all devices connected to Cheerlights. I connected some addressable LEDs to Cheerlights using an Adafruit Huzzah ESP8266. I also designed and 3D printed an enclosure for the electronics.

item.title: Neopixel LGBT Pride Necklace
item.description:
This necklace uses an Adafruit Gemma and a Neopixel ring to display LGBT pride flag colors. The wearer can cycle through animations with a button. Code for rainbow, trans, bi, and pan flags is available. A diffuser is 3D printed from white PLA.
